translation.alarm_tooltip: Enables an audible or visual alert when a specific condition is met, such as receiving a signal on a monitored frequency or when a timer expires.
translation.backlight_brightness_tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the display backlight to improve visibility in various lighting conditions while balancing battery consumption.
translation.backlight_timeout_tooltip: Sets how long the display backlight remains on after the last user interaction before automatically turning off to save battery.
translation.bat_save_ratio_tooltip: Controls how aggressively the radio reduces power consumption during receive mode by cycling the receiver on and off, trading slight responsiveness for extended battery life.
translation.bat_save_tooltip: Reduces power consumption by dimming the display and limiting background processes when the radio is idle, extending battery life during portable use.
translation.bcl_tooltip: Prevents transmission when the channel is already in use, helping to avoid interference.
translation.beep_tooltip: Enables a short audible tone for button presses and other user interface actions, providing feedback to the user.
translation.busy_channel_lockout_tooltip: Prevents transmission when the channel is already in use, helping to avoid interference.
translation.channel_display_mode_tooltip: Sets the information shown on the display for each channel, allowing users to choose between viewing frequency, channel ID, or channel name based on their preference.
translation.channel_empty_body: The channel slot contains no configured frequency or essential settings and is not usable for communication.
translation.channel_volume_tooltip: Sets the audio output volume level for the specified channel, allowing customization of loudness for individual channels based on user preference or environmental conditions.
translation.chrome_required_body: This application uses the Web Serial API, which is currently only supported in Google Chrome.
translation.cw_pitch_freq_tooltip: Sets the audio frequency (in Hz) of the Morse code (CW) tone generated by the radio during CW transmissions, allowing customization for user preference or to match other equipment.
translation.denoise_level_tooltip: Adjusts the intensity of the digital noise reduction algorithm to minimize background static and improve audio clarity during reception. Higher levels provide more noise suppression but may also affect weak signal intelligibility.
translation.device_name_tooltip: Sets a custom name for the radio device, which may be displayed on the screen or used for identification in software applications.
translation.dmr_call_contact_tooltip: The contact to call in DMR mode, such as an individual user or group.
translation.dmr_color_code_tooltip: Radios with different Color Codes will not hear each other, even on the same frequency and time slot. For successful communication, frequency, time slot, and Color Code must match for all participants.
translation.dmr_contact_id_tooltip: DMR contact ID (1–16,777,214). For individual calls, use the radio's unique ID; for group calls, use a Talk Group number (e.g., 9 for Worldwide).
translation.dmr_encryption_key_tooltip: Sets the encryption key used for secure DMR communications. This key must match the one used by the remote station to ensure encrypted message delivery.
translation.dmr_id_tooltip: Unique identifier for your radio in DMR networks.
translation.dmr_rx_list_tooltip: Group list defining which contacts or talkgroups your radio will receive in DMR mode. Multiple contacts can be included in a single list.
translation.dmr_slot_tooltip: Selects which DMR slot (1 or 2) to use for transmission or reception. Dual slot mode allows switching between two different DMR IDs or settings.
translation.dual_watch_priority_ab_tooltip: Specifies which receiver (A or B) remains active after a signal is received in dual-watch mode. When set to OFF, the receiver that last received a signal stays active; when set to A or B, the selected receiver always resumes after any transmission ends.
translation.dual_watch_tooltip: Enables monitoring of two channels simultaneously, automatically switching to the active one when a signal is detected.
translation.fm_tooltip: Enables listening to commercial FM broadcast radio.
translation.frequency_lock_430: 430: Restricts transmission to specific sub-bands within the 70 cm amateur band (430–440 MHz).
translation.frequency_lock_ce: CE: Applies European Union frequency and emission limits.
translation.frequency_lock_fcc: FCC: Restricts operation to U.S. FCC-approved bands and power levels.
translation.frequency_tooltip: The radio frequency used for receiving and transmitting signals.
translation.hello_mode_tooltip: Controls the type of information displayed on the screen when the radio is idle.
translation.hello_msg_str_x_tooltip: Text displayed on the screen when the radio is turned on.
translation.hello_steps: Select your model, read, change, write, enjoy!
translation.high_no_tx_tooltip: Blocks transmission if battery voltage is abnormally high (rarely used).
translation.k5_firmware_versions_disclaimer: Firmware for different revision are not compatible. Flashing the wrong version may brick your radio—always confirm your hardware revision first.
translation.keypad_lock_auto_tooltip: Prevents accidental changes to settings or unintended transmissions by disabling the keypad except for essential functions like PTT or emergency keys.
translation.language_tooltip: Sets the language used in the radio's display and menu system.
translation.low_no_tx_tooltip: Blocks transmission when battery voltage is too low (protects battery).
translation.mic_gain_tooltip: Adjusts the sensitivity of the microphone to control the strength of your transmitted audio signal.
translation.modulation_tooltip: The type of frequency modulation used for the signal, affecting bandwidth and audio quality. Common modes include FM (standard narrowband), NFM (narrower bandwidth), and WFM (wideband, typically for broadcast reception).
translation.name: Name
translation.offset_tooltip: The difference between the transmit and receive frequencies, used to enable communication through repeaters or to avoid interference when operating simplex.
translation.power_tooltip: Transmit power level; use low power for short-range communication to save battery and reduce interference, high power for longer range when needed.
translation.roger_beep_select_tooltip: A short audible tone sent at the end of a transmission to indicate the speaker has finished talking.
translation.roger_beep_tooltip: A short audible tone sent at the end of a transmission to indicate the speaker has finished talking.
translation.rtone_tooltip: Transmits a brief tone to access repeaters or signal other radios equipped to respond to tone bursts.
translation.scan_behavior_tooltip: Controls whether and how the channel is included during scanning operations, allowing it to be skipped, scanned normally, or given higher attention.
translation.scan_mode_tooltip: Defines the scanning method used when searching for active signals across channels or frequencies.
translation.scan_tooltip: Automatically checks channels for activity and stops on active ones.
translation.send_ptt_id_tooltip: Sends a short identifying signal (such as a callsign or code) automatically when the PTT button is pressed, allowing other users to identify the transmitting station.
translation.sql_ste_tooltip: Introduces a short delay before the transmitter fully turns off, ensuring the repeater properly recognizes the end of transmission and resets correctly.
translation.sql_tooltip: Noise suppression threshold: higher = quieter background, but weak signals may be blocked.
translation.squelch_tooltip: Tone-based access control that mutes the speaker unless a specific sub-audible tone (CTCSS) or digital code (DCS) is detected, reducing unwanted noise from other users on the same frequency.
translation.timeout_alarm_tooltip: Audible alert when the transmit timeout timer is reached.
translation.tot_tooltip: Limits continuous transmit time to prevent overheating or PTT stuck.
translation.unlock_en350_tooltip: In some regions (e.g., parts of Europe or North America), consumer-grade radios are legally allowed to receive this band
translation.unlock_scramble_tooltip: Enables built-in voice scrambling for basic privacy; may be disabled or locked in certain radio models or firmware versions due to regional regulations or manufacturer restrictions.
translation.unlock_tx200_tooltip: This band includes VHF high-band and parts of UHF, often used for professional, commercial, or public safety services. Transmitting here may be restricted or prohibited for amateur or consumer radios depending on regional regulations.
translation.unlock_tx350_tooltip: The 350–400 MHz frequency band is allocated for various critical services—such as public safety, emergency response, military, and government communications—differently across countries.
translation.unlock_tx500_tooltip: This band is typically allocated for specialized services such as land mobile radio, public safety, or cellular networks, and is generally not authorized for amateur or consumer radio use in most countries. Transmitting in this range without proper licensing may violate national telecommunications regulations and interfere with critical communications.
translation.voice_language_tooltip: Selects the language used for voice prompts and feedback.
translation.voice_prompt_tooltip: Enables spoken feedback for menu navigation and settings changes, enhancing usability without needing to look at the display.
translation.vox_delay_tooltip: Sets the time interval the VOX feature waits after detecting sound before stopping transmission, allowing for brief pauses in speech without cutting off the transmission prematurely.
translation.vox_inhibit_tooltip: Disables VOX while receiving to prevent false activation from incoming audio.
translation.vox_level_tooltip: Adjusts how sensitive the VOX feature is to sound; higher sensitivity means it will activate with quieter sounds, while lower sensitivity requires louder sounds to trigger transmission.
translation.vox_tooltip: Voice-activated transmission that automatically starts transmitting when the microphone detects sound above a certain threshold, allowing hands-free operation.
